text: Hatalmas, de nem túl tartós hab, vörösbe hajló, sötétbarna szín. Csokis, karamelles, pörkölt malátás illat. Csokis, karamelles, pörkölt malátás ízvilág, markáns komlós-fűszeres aromákkal, némi aszalt gyümölcsös mellékízzel. Testes, közepesen keserű és szénsavas. Komoly, nehézsúlyú sör, nem egész estés iszogatáshoz való.

Bouteille à la maison. Je filais pour revisiter certains classiques. Je trouve quil est important de se livrer à cet exercice à loccasion. Je ne me site aucunement en exemple, car je ne suis pas très assidu à cette tâche et cest justement pour ça que je le souligne lorsque je my adonne. Javais le souvenir dune bière plus sombre. Le liquide est aujourdhui assez clair. Tête qui comme dans mes souvenirs est dun blanc cassé presque jaune et formée de grosses bulles. Arômes conformes à mes souvenirs, marqués par des fruits noirs tels la mûre sauvage auxquels on aurait ajouté des cerises. Manque de rondeur et de profondeur pour mon appreciation personnelle mais ça demeure agréable. Saveurs qui me conviennent davantage où le raisin noir se marie parfaitement à un goût de pain fraîchement sorti du four. Lalcool nest pas à négliger non plus. Mince. Trop mince pour le style à mon avis. Je préfère les brunes belges avec davantage de corps et plus moelleuses. Nempêche, une très belle adaptation du style que lon oublie trop souvent.

Look: dark red almost clear.

Aroma: slightly roasted with sweet compote fruits.
Taste: light sweet with light sourness.
Flavour: roasted nuts, candied fruits, light spicy notes.

medium and sourly aroma  fruits and berries with alcohol, flowers, some red wine notes, Belgian yeasts. 
medium taste  fermented fruits and berries, rum, flowers, some dry herbs and hop bitterness. good beer!
BOTTLE 500 CL shared. Fruity, caramel and spicy winy notes (that get lost as it warms up), a bit of toasted grains. Light fruity estery notes, simple candyish sugars, light spice. Decent.

Reddish brown, small head, clear. Sweet tropical, banana, Belgian yeast aroma. Stove hints of wine and barrel. Simple taste with lots of carbonation in the body. Malty and fruity, but sharp aftertaste.

500ml bottle at home. Deep mahogany colour, creamy and stable beige head. Brown sugar, dried fruits like raisins and figs, herbal, cough syrup. Quite complex malty, well balanced. Good body, lively carbonation.

A full light tan head on a dark mahogany body. The nose is relatively subtle with rich malt, brown sugar and hints of candied fruit and acidity. This is a lovely bit of craftsmanship. Smooth caramel malt is the base element with dark berries, raisins and candied fruit. there are touches of rum-like warmth, fruity esters and toffee, A smooth, full bodies Abbey Dubbel with well balanced complexities.

Une dubel élégante qui offre son bouquet de fruits confits, datte, raisins secs et figues dune façon claires et relativement légère. On ne croit pas être en train de boire une biere 8% avec celle-ci. Je lai gouté peu vieillit mais je serais curieux de recommencé lexperience avec une bouteille dun an ou deux

Hazed ruddy color with a diminished light tan colored head. Sweet caramel and spice cake scents. Flavors start sweet, but lead to a more acidic, spicy center. Somewhat biting on the tongue. Mild warmth noted. The light feel makes this quite drinkable and nearly refreshing for a double. 8/10

Light brown foamy head. Dark brown colour. Aroma is malty with raisins, prunes and light coffe notes. Flavor is malty too with dates, raisins and light roasty tones, ending in a fruity and slighlty roasty finish. Medium bodied.

Apparence : Brune, trouble, dépôts dans le fond, gros col beige avec une bonne rétention et laissant une fine dentelle. Effervescence semble moyenne et plutôt rapide. 

Nez : Malt, un peu dépices, un peu de fruits séchés. Intensité moyenne. 

Goût : Maltée, légère amertume (difficile à croire que cette bière nait que 10 dIBU), sucrée, mais balancée par cette amertume. 

Sensation : Effervescence moyenne, corps moyen, chaleur dalcool présente en gorge, légèrement piquante sur la langue, finale de longueur moyenne. 

O : Jai été déçu par la «simplicité» de cette bière. Très maltée, les épices et les fruits ne sont pas assez dominants à mon goût. De plus, ce malt est intéressant, sans plus. On ne retrouve pas de réelles différences entre lentrée, le mi-palais et la finale; aucune évolution des saveurs ou presque. 
Ceci étant dit, ce nest pas mauvais, mais je ne considère pas ça comme une bière de dégustation.
Javais un meilleur souvenir que ça de cette bière.

Veiled dark brown copper color with moderate activity. Slightly foamy light brown 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with some good legs.

Aroma of toffee and vinous dark fruits, a little faint. Flavors of dark berries, grapes, caramel, tobacco, herbal spices. Bready with a strong fruity estery sugary syrupy feel.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Well intensified medium strength finish, ending with herbal spicy hops and a thick fruity tongue coat.

Overall a pretty good craft having decent flavors and a nice balance. Slightly off with the freshness being highly vinous.

Bouteille 500 ml

Couleur : Brune foncée avec des reflets rouges, une bonne carbonation qui sestompe assez vite toutefois, et une bonne effervescence.

Arômes : Assez subtil arôme de sucre dorge et de sirop dérable, on sent également les raisins rouges.

Goût : Principalement les raisins rouges et de sucre. Les 8% dalcool réchauffent en douceur le palet au fil des gorgées, alors que le sucre résiduel nous rappelle le goût du sucre dore en fin de bouche.

Appréciation : Cest bien fait et agréable. On ne sent pas les 8% faisant de cette bière une boisson à haut degré de buvabilité. Ça doit être assez intéressant dans sa version vieillie en fût de Zinfandel.

Voilà une bière que jai bue quelques fois mais que je navais pas pris le temps de rater. Bière brune aux reflets acajou, avec une mousse généreuse et de couleur crème. Nez de fruits confis, de cassis et de sucre brun. En bouche, le caramel ressort puis des notes fruitées se pointent le nez. Liquoreuse, goûteuse, sans défaut apparent. Dubbel classique savoureuse. Anytime. Cheers!

Excellente Dubbel. Goût de caramel et dépices, sans trop dexagération. Elle se boit très bien malgré un % dalcool à 8%. 

À réessayer après un vieillissement dau moins 1 an.
Bonne carbonation, mais peu de mousse. Robe marron, bon taux dalcool masqué par le corps. Au goût, des notes de vanille et caramel très prononcées, presque sucré même.
From a 50 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a clear mahogany with an ecru head. Caramel aroma. Flavors of toffee. Light bitter finish.

50cl bottle, served in Trappist glass. Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is caramel, dark fruits and hints of licorice. Flavour is more or less the same, vanilla notes are remarkable as well. Very pleasant sweetness on the palate without being cloying at all. The finish is moderately dry, but relevant in a beer like this. Medium body, perfect carbonation. Thats a really nice and balanced Dubbel, great job.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 26B). Bottle 50 cl - Batch unknown (bottle on 2013/01/04). AROMA: a complex aroma of toasted bread crust, spicy and clove-like phenols and peppery alcohol, with a malty-sweet background. APPEARANCE: dark ambar color and translucent with slight ruby highlights. average light brown head with good retention. TASTE: predominant malt toasted flavour with maillard products, slight caramel and a hint of chocolate. slight peppery alcohol with a somewhat sweet background. low bitterness with a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium body with medium-high carbonation. alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a nice canadian Dubbel with more malt notes than esters.

Bouteille de 500ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Des tonnes de mousse beige sur cette brune aux reflets ambrés. Elle finit par se résorber après un long moment, mais non sans laisser une jolie dentelle. Arôme de caramel brûlé, vanille, fruits (dattes, figues). En bouche cest semblable, moyenne de corps, moyennement carbonatée, moyennement sucrée, caramel brûlé, sucre et vanille, avec un fond de fruits bruns (dattes/figues. prunes) avec un soupcon de chocolat. Excellente dubbel, merci Charlevoix!

Bottle 50cl, a brown beer with good copper head. Nose is on caramel and quadruple like yeast. Aroma is malty, spicy, fruity, caramel, toffee, really complex, rochefort yeast, sweet, vanilla, cinnamon, banana, dry grapes, light fig and diacetyl, very nice.

Pours a dark brown/copper color with a huge tan head and lots of carbonation. Fruit jam, raisins, nuts, chocolat, prunes. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, medium alcool finish. Its pretty sweet but you get a little citrus sourness to it. Not bad at all just wished the taste was a little more balanced.

A bit cloudy brown Colorado and a beige medium big head. The aroma is toffee, spice cake, burned caramel, raisin, plums, chocolate and nuts, vanilla, clove, cinnamon. Rich. The has a lively carbonation reminding me a cocacola. Quite oily. Medium sweet with chocolate and raisins as a back bone. The bitterness is earthy with notes like clove and fruit seeds. Finish is fruity and earthy. Good balance and a satisfying beer.

Robe brune ambrée, col de mousse crémeux et généreux. Dentelle epaisse et collante. Arômes de chocolat, anis, figues, raisins secs, un peu dherbes. Un léger côté acidulé se dégage. En bouche, goût de chocolat, herbes, raisins secs et levures belges. Des effluves de malt et noisettes se dégagent par la suite pour créer une belle amertume. Texture modérée, labondance de fines bulles masque un peu trop les saveurs. Moyennement ronde et les saveurs sont assez brèves. Bonne dubbel mais jai vu mieux.

Bottle from the brewpub
Rich chocolate caramel and fruit notes. Paired great with the raspberry brownie ice cream I had for desert.

Bottle. Slightly sour aroma with fresh strawberries and faint pickle juice as it warms. Some brown sugar sweetness. Hazy mahogany under a persistent, light brown blanket. Complex malty brown sugar and dried fruit flavour with no bitterness and a very light nuttiness that comes in late with an almost dry bitterness. Medium to full body, smooth, medium high carbonation.

Tojáslikőr színű krémhabja alatt sűrű szójatest lapul, tejszínesen krémes illatnyalábjai puha szövettel borítják be az aszalt szilvás, mazsolás szárazságú, befőttszerűen édes és ánizsos fűszerezettségű aromaszerkezetet. Illata gazdagságát csak zamatos ízjegyei sokszínűsége múlja felül, klasszikus belga komponensekkel bőségesen megtömött teste mintha csak egy kolostor falai közül került volna az üvegbe. Sima és tiszta kortyai egészséges vadsággal közvetítik a palackban elterülő ódon italköltemény magasztos mondanivalóját. Kandiscukorral édesített, nemesen alkoholos ízjegyei fűszeres aszalványok fanyarságát rejtik magukban, élesztőtől hangos szerkezete megnyugtató intenzitással tárja elénk a dubbelek legjavát. Örök érvényű alkotás, megérdemelten foglalja el a helyét a legjobbak között.

Embouteillée le 21-03-2013... On sent les fruits séchés, les bananes, lalcool et la levure. Cest aussi bon que dans mon souvenir; une des meilleures doubles que jai pu goûter sans contredit. Rien ne détonne, tout est parfaitement en harmonie. Belle réussite!

Dark brown body, large head, looks amazing. Well developed, dark fruit like figs and prune. Pumpkin pie spices, crusty bread. Large amount of flavour, bit woody, barn, fruity, rustic, hay and bitter enough. Only in the end does the alcohol come to play. Quite dry actually too, in taste. Slightly undercarbonated. The best dubbel I have tasted in ages! It almost single handedly would convince me to drink those more often of even brew one... (50cl bottle from Bière Revolution)
Still very new to this style. Will re-evaluate later. For now, I feel like this one is laking that nice caramel, rond bodied sweetness that I enjoy in other dubbels. Rating pending.

Bottle from Guyon farm, share with wife. Aroma: dark fruits, raisins, spices, alcohol. App: brown with red glint. Small beige head. Taste and palate: medium body, a tad creamy, high carbonation, sweet molasses and dark fruit finish. Overall: Really good, easy to drink to its smoothness feel in mouth.

500ml bottle. Dark ruby/brown. The head lets it down compared to most Belgian dubbels. Aroma is very good though. Chocolate, prune, orange peel and leather, plus the spices really come to the fore. Taste follows similar lines, and whilst enjoyable it doesnt feel nearly as elegant as the aroma did. Spiciness here is more from the yeast than anything added. Plenty of positives but I wish everything coalesced a bit more.

Pours very dark reddish brown with a foamy tan head. Aromas of raisins, figs, dates, muscovado sugar, plum. Taste is raisins, dates, figs, plum, muscovado sugar, roasted notes. Mouthfeel is smooth with medium carbonation.

Pours murky dark brown with low tan head. Aroma of raisins, rye bread, prunes and dates, earth. Taste is chocolate sweet, roasty with light coffee, lingering sweet finish. Body is light to medium and creamy smooth with soft to average carbonation.

Double de Dominus Vobiscum. Draft de raisins secs,prunes,date,anis, légè caramel, pétillement timide.En Bouche cest soyeux très bien balancé. Des notes épicées se love avec un caramel chaud et des petite touche de fruits murs ce confondent et ce perdent dans une final légèrement amère mais un petit peut sucré, non franchement cest bien.

Squat bottle from Smiths. Pours deep ruby with no head. Tastes caramelly, sweet, cloying and malty, with mild hops, some fruity and vegetal notes, and a crappy finish. This is a drain pour, my first in years.  Got even more vegetal as it warmed.

Lots of aroma coming off this beauty. Initial sniffs brought forward some very grape juice notes, that gave way after a moment to raisin, toffee, and lightly roasted grain. The dark beige head was between fizzy and foamy and retained nicely. The colour is a rich brown with some cloudiness. The flavour is sweetness finished with some bitterness and a touch of umami slides in there at the end as well. The after taste lingers for a few moments and is just this side of bitter. The medium body could be a tad more full to really help carry the flavours, but otherwise very nice.
Buena cerveza de abadia compleja con muchos matices dulces pero sin pesadez al paladar. Mejora a temperatura de 10º.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy brown, toffee, vanilla, raisins, sweet, not bad.

Bottle from Viti, Vancouver; bottled 2013-01-04, 1 year oldDark brown color, barely penetrable, with generous beige creamy head. Deep aroma of caramel, with reminders of liquorice, cellar, mold and ammonia, cream and bread, old-style Belgian; ending with light blueberry; very interesting. The mouthfeel is lean, very smooth; harmonious caramel flavor with a nutty and fruity touch; the bitterness is quite low, although some nutty roastiness provides bitter notes. The final is a bit weak and short.Just a tad less sweet than Belgian beers, but its an impressive example of elegance and nuances.

Bottle sample from notes. Pours dark brown in color with a creamy beige head. The aroma and flavor has figs and dates, caramel, yeast, cloves and some additional spices, vinous notes, light anise, bubblegum, candi sugar, and mild woody notes. Pretty sweet overall.
Aroma is sweet malt and also some spiciness. Dark fruits and belgian sugars. Taste is very fruit with a warm liquor finish. Body is very dark with a pearl head that retains very well.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Apparence: Une excellente double foncé coiffée d?une belle mousse onctueuse.Arômes: Fruits confis.Saveurs: Légère amertume, un corps liquoreux et sucré. À déguster avec des cotes levées ou en fin de soirée auprès d?un bon feu au mois de janvier.Fiche technique :Style: Double d?AbbeyFormat: 500 ml Taux d?alcool : 8% Température: 8°C - 14°C IBU: 10

Bottle. pours brown with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, some spicy notes, tea and yeast. Flavor is sweet caramel with some malt, dried red fruits and spices. medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 500ml @ yngwie
Pours clear reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits, spices and hint of alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Deep dark color with a tan head. Punchy, smooth, but a good dark fruit mix (cherry, raisin, fig). Light tartness, rolling finish. Very full and strong.

Rated on 11-13-2010 (Bottle) When poured, this beer has a huge very fizzy beige head that mostly diminishes, hazy body, fizzy carbonation, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aromas are caramel malt, cinnamon, dark fruits, spicy, alcohol and raisins. The taste is sweet, cinnamon, spicy, caramel malt, lightly bitter, and dark fruits. The mouth feel is lively carbonation and a bit of a warming sensation. This beer is medium bodied. This beer is very quaffable and a sipping beer. The flavors come together very well and this is a beer of good quality and worth trying. I recommend this beer and this is a beer I would drink again.

Color rojizo oscuro con espuma beige. Aromas de regaliz, caramelo y frutas confitadas con trazas de naranja. Densidad media con sabor de frutas confitadas, melaza y regaliz con puntos ácidos. Muy rica.

Belle brune avec des arômes de fruits foncés. Une attaque épicé et sucré très bien équilibré. Elle est même douce pour une bière de 8%. Le goût évolue, on shabitue aux épices, et encore plus de goûts fruités se démarquent. Le pétillement fait quelle nest jamais plate. À recommender.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2014 Bière brune foncée aux reflets rougeâtre, voilée, très effervescente, et surmontée dune copieuse mousse brunâtre, dense et rocailleuse, qui laisse une riche dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes bien sucrés et maltés, réglisse, mélasse, caramel, cassonade, remplis dabondant petits fruits foncés confits (raisins secs, pruneaux, dattes). Il y a également dévidents effluves de pain, pâtisserie, gâteau, cette bière dégage des odeurs pouvant rappeler le gâteau aux dattes ou le muffin aux raisins secs. Un agréable parfum danis et une touche dalcool se dégage également du breuvage. Le nez est fort agréable et bien complexe, il manque peut-être un peu dintensité cependant. En bouche, légèrement pétillante sur la langue, cette bière est dune intense onctuosité au palais. Elle est bien ronde, riche et soyeuse! Au goût, on a affaire à une véritable invasion de pruneaux, dattes, raisins secs, et autres fruits confits, arrosé dune riche saveur de caramel, le tout enrobé de pain légèrement grillé, de pâtisserie et de gâteau. Passablement sucré, les saveurs sont savamment équilibrées par la présence en fin de bouche dun léger houblon plutôt herbacé amenant une délicate amertume. De chaudes épices sont présentes tout au long de la dégustation, surtout de lanis, mais des saveurs plus poivrées comme du piment de la Jamaïque semblent être également présentes. Complexe, intense en bouche et délicieuse, cette bière est un gros coup de cur pour moi!

Bottle 500ml.Clear light dark red brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, bread, caramel, berry, moderate to light heavy yeasty, spicy yeast, dark berries, anis seed, bubble gum notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, fruity, berry, yeasty, candy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20131230]

500ml bottle. Hazy burgundy with no head. Aroma is dark fruits, pepper, cloves, star anis, toasted malts and chocolate. Taste is raisins, plum, apples, cherry, toffee and spices. Medium body, lively carbonation, sticky texture.

Bottle to tulip
Sweet cherryish, raisin and apple with lots of yeast.
Deep brown, almost black with a 1.5 cm frothy tan head. Taste is upfront with cherry, toasted malts, and a light touch of anise chocolate, and pepper; yeast notes throughout.

Bottle @tasting. Pours cloudy and brown. Star anise on the nose with fruity as well. Same on the palate a spicy/fruity beer, i wrote on paper, trying to be a Belgium abbey ale, they have done the job quite well.
Bottle at Craigs. Hazy brown pour, off-white head. Herbal aromas, some raisin notes. Tastes much the same. Not a stand-out.
Cloudy light brown, decent ringed head. Lovely floral spice, clean bitterness and rusty malt. Hungry, steamy mouthfeel. Firm finish, lightly cheesy. Bottle, Beers of Europe, Sinner Series Tasting
Bottle. Brown with off white head. Aroma is quite meaty with herbs, spices and cola. Taste has lots of cola, some chocolate and light spices. Dry finish. Tasty and interesting
Bottle at home... Deep brown... Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet spiced raisins... Over fizzy... Gren raisins... Light tart fruits... Musty malts... Soft spice... Not working for me

Kobber klar skum råhvid kort 
Brød nødder karamel brændt sukkermalt humle støvet 
Bitter lidt sød modrate 
Cremet blød 
@peter c

Mørkt brød, malt, frugt, blomme, vinøs, mørkt rød, sød, Brandt sukker, Lust skum, medium, cremet , blød.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Évaluation no.47 Décembre 2010
Aucun nez perçu. De couleur brune avec une mousse persistante et onctueuse. Maltée avec un caramel persistant, des relents de fruits confits et un soupçon de cannelle.

Pours a clear reddish brown with a large creamy beige head leaving lots of lace. Aroma is a complex mix of rich maltiness, fruity esters(raisins, plums and apples), toast, and some spicy phenols. Some perfumey qualities are definitely present. Flavour is a lot like the aroma: complex rich maltiness, sweet candy syrup, fruity esters (raisins, plums, apple, dried cherries), toasty, some spicy esters(clove like), and light alcohol.

500ml bottle. 
Poured a tan head that left lace. Good bubbles. 
Smell: carmel and chocolate.
Taste: Sweet, dark fruits (figs, raisins, dates) no bitterness and a bit of booze but not the 8% on the label.spices. No Malt

Bottle very dark amber Body with notbvery long lasting tan head. Very malty belgium aroma. Taste is very nice and smooth With some malts and some dried fruits. Aftertaste is very nice some sweetnes some bitterness. Nice one

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark mahogany with huge head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of vegetable juice, licorice, and over ripe dark fruit. Flavors are similar with the addition of dates, tobacco, and dark caramel. Slightly sour finish.
Bottled. Deep amber colour, small beige head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, some mild spices. Flavour is toffee, mild liquorice, some spices and a bit of alcohol. Smooth. Very nice.
Bottle 0.5l. Bottled on April 13th 2011. Best Before April 13th 2014. Colour is brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, raisins, some sweetness and malts.
500 ml. bottle. Pours a cloudy reddish borwon with a decent biege head. Aroma of fruit, malt, yeast, and spice. Taste is dark fruit, malt, yeast, spice, and caramel. Very, very good.

Pours a clear dark amber with a huge light brown head thats leaves a ring of lace with every sip. Aroma of rich malty sweetness, caramel, bready, fruity esters like raisins and a slight bit of alcohol to round out a wonderful Aroma. Taste is a nice rich malty sweet base mixed with yeasty phenols, dried fruits like raising and alcohol all interplay nicely while still finishing semi dry. Overall a wicked interplay of flavors and a great blend for an 8 percent to beer. Definitely not for lager boys but for those who want a fucking awesome dubbel!

Pours a very dark reddish brown with a frothy, active off-white head. True to its description, the aroma is dried/confit-ed fruit (prunes come out for sure), and of rum soaked raisins. Bit bready. Cardamom? Good belgian yeast character. Slight antiseptic coming through. Taste is mature fruity over subtle bitterness. Antiseptic still there, continues to come out as beer warms. Palate is a flattish carbonation, but good body, creamy. Not bad. looking forward to trying the second bottle in the basement to compare.

demi-litre (embouteillé le 13 avril 2011) - ça verse un marron fonçé avec un peu de mousse beige à grosses bulles. Il y a un odorat fruité et de pain. La première gorgée introduit des noix, des fruits de bois et un peu de levure. Cest un peu vineux. Sucré et légèrement amer. Une bonne bière dhiver mais elle lui manque un peu de caractère. Ravi de lavoir eu mais le prix ($6.99 E.U.) est trop cher pour ce que cest; une bouteille de 75cl peut être.

2013/09/21 - Pours a hazy, dark mahogany colour with a creamy, off white head that lingers. Aroma is huge on dark fruits: plums, cherries and grapes. Also detect apricots, molasses and toasted malts. Taste follows nose; lots of dark fruits, sweet malts, molasses and slight coffee. Mouthfeel is oily with appropriate carbonation and a mildly warming finish. Not a bad dubbel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle from Ales by Mail

Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma of syrup, dark ripe fruits, plums, spices and bready notes. Taste is sweet, malty and spicy with notes of plums, dark ripe fruits and bready notes. Finish is sweet, smooth and fruity. Okay, quite balanced but sweet dubbel.

Bouteille de 500ml. 4,99$ chez Saucisserie BDF. Dégustée 8 mois après embouteillage. Bière brune avec reflet rougeâtre avec une mousse beige très dense. Odeur de fruits mûres, raisins secs, caramal et malt brulé. En bouche on goûte le caramel, le malt brulé et les nombreuses épices. Aucune amertume. Le sucre résiduel reste présent sur les lèvres après chaque gorgée. En somme un bon produit.

50 cl bottle @ HeBF13. Bottled 13.04.2011, BBE 13.04.2014
Aroma has soapy apricot, some sugary notes and hints of alcohol. Flavour is rather sweet with slightly burned (or brown) sugar, some apricot, ripe fruits, hints of alcohol and distant spicy notes. The appearance of a dubbel, the flavour is somewhere between belgian blonde and dubbel. And closer to the blonde
Ai niitä veliempojoja vai?

pienen känninkin uhalla 4/5. tuoksu jälleen kerran vaisu, suutuntuma lievästi alkoholia mutta häipyy pian, aika okein raikkahan ookoo jälkifiilis. alkuillasta maisteltuna taitais saada enempi pojoja. nyt keskitasoa koska käni. pisteet voivat olla kovemmat kuin yleisarvosana.

500 ml bottle @ HeBF. Pours a murky dark brown colour with a white head. Aroma of pumpkin, apricot, palm and grass. Flavour of sweet pumpkin, caramel, banana, nuts and syrup. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and a sweet malty fruity finish. Rather well balanced.

50 cl bottle @ HBF13.
Pours hazy red color with a small off-white head. Aroma of pumpkin, spices, caramel malts, some yeast and berries. Flavor of sugar, caramel malts, ripe fruits like plums and raisins, toffee, dark sweet berries, hints of syrup and caramel. Feels like a weird combination of an abbey dubbel and an american strong ale. Very obscure but cant find a reason to hate this.

500ml bottle. Clear ruby red glowing dark brown colour with small to average, creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Fruity aroma has notes of red and dark berries, plum, cherries, dry hints of fruit parings, a touch of liquorice. Taste is moderately sweet fruity, hints of black cherries, dark berries, plum, a tart touch, dry hints of fruit parings, some liquorice with a very cautious salty touch; soft carbonation, smooth, soft, minimally sticky palate. Complex, thereby very well balanced. Superb.

Deep brown body with some reddish highlights, medium sized light tan head, soapy lacing. Classic dark fruit profile (prunes and plums), coca-cola, leather, just a hing of tobacco. Medium bodied, moderate malt sweetness, lingering finish, assertive but appropriate carbonation. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a moderate off-white head. Nose has some subtle sugary elements with a bit of dark fruit elements in there. Taste isnt too sweet, but definitely has those fruit elements in there.

Belmont bottle marked 2010 Fev 04. Mmmmmm...thats good dubbel even when drank straight from the bottle; sitting on the top porch enjoying the spring evening. Big carbonation that grows a head out of the opened bottle.  Absolutely classic taste of dark fruit, Semarang sugar and a little spice. Maybe even some sour funk lurking. Fantastic.

(Dégustée en fût à laveugle, dans un verre noir, dans le cadre de lIris du goût) - Nez sucré de mélasse. En bouche, on vacille entre les raisins secs, le caramel, le malt généralement grillé et le bonbon. Selon mes souvenirs pas si lointain, la version bouteille était plus épicée et moins sucrée. Cette fois, jai eu limpression davoir un scotch ale dans mon verre... comme quoi les styles peuvent parfois savoisiner.

500 ml, Peluso, 8%. Brune avec 2 doigts de mousse. Odeur de malt caramel. Gout de malt caramel bien sucré avec épices. Carbonation plutôt faible. Liquoreuse. 
Très bien balancée, délicieuse.

Beautiful deep brown-black with nice rocky head. Lovely. Wonderful dried fruit and mild spiciness. Great full mouthfeel. Super beer.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur brune et claire. Nez de réglisse noire, de malt toffee, de levures épicées (léger de poivre et de clou de girofle, notes de muscade) et moyennement fruité (figues, léger de raisins avec des traces dagrume sucrées, de prunes et de pommes)  avec des notes dalcool et de sucre brun. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (raisins aux notes vineux, léger dagrumes très sucrées, notes de figues, de prunes et de pommes) et assez épicé (moyen de muscade et danis, notes de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel vient se joindre un goût malté de caramel toffee, léger sucre brun avec des traces de sucre bonbon puis une finale lon retrouve une légère amertume dalcool doux avec des notes poivrées et de houblon herbeux. Post-goût long et un peu sec, légèrement amer dalcool très doux, moyen danis avec des notes fruitées (léger de moût de raisins et notes de figues).

Une magnifique double, un brin sucrée mais absolument délicieuse. Des notes de caramel, de cassonnade et de fruits mûrs ressortent tour à tour. Belle couleur chocolat sous une généreuse mousse espresso. Sans doute lune des meilleures, sinon la première de sa catégorie au Québec.

8th May 20119.0% bottle. Hazy dark brown beer, short lived pale tan head. Airy palate, dry. Sweet airy malt. Trace of mild chocolate. Coca cola and tame ginger. Dry finish with a sweet minerally aftertaste. Unusual taste profile. Works for me!

d une couleur rouge  et abec un beau col blanc  on sens les fruit confit et une legere gout floral elle liquoreuse et un bouche le gout de fruit et mélanger avec un petit gout de floral donne une belle compleciter a la bieres elle vraiment bonne (rate 29)
Bottle. Color unclear deep red with medium brown head. Aroma yeast, caramel, cherry, spicy. Taste sweet, malt, black cherry, licorice.

Ici nous avons le summum du pub selon moi.  On nen prend pas deux, mais bien une et on la déguste lentement.  On appréciera sa mousse généreuse et ses effluves de levure.  Une mousse qui colle au verre et qui saccroche jusquà la fin.  Cest une expérience!

Bonne bière riche, ce que jappelle une bière repas. Ne se déguste  pas après un repas, vous comprendrez pourquoi. Cest une bière forte mais pas trop imposante en gout dalcool. Son goût sucré, fruit de raisins, est surprenant pour une bière de cette ampleur. son gout se rapproche de celui du vin. De couleur brun foncé, on sapproche de la couleur dune porter, la mousse est correcte et durable. La bière est pétillante en bouche à souhait. Je la trouve un peu trop fruitée pour le style mais cest tout te même excellent.
Bouteille de 500ml, robe brune au reflets violets, arôme de raisins confis , goût de petits fruits et de levure. Peut être la meilleur dubbel au Qc.

500 ml bottle

Thanks to tastybeer for sharing this beer which he picked up locally. I have skipped on a couple of their releases because of the price point. This one does not change my mind. Unless I was trying to increase my Canadian ticks or there was a great sale I do not see myself buying any others.

Aroma / Appearance - The deep caramel red base is warm as it glows. Absorbing most of the light it looks like a rich setting sun. Cloudy bubbly gum, candy yeast, and black cherries merge with a nutty base. Once it escapes the nice looking head it hangs like a firefly in the air before fading away.

Flavor / Palate - Nutty cherry pie, almonds, and dates give this a fruity feel. This feels mildly boozy by the end of the first pour. It is a passable dubbel but nothing special. For that reason Ill pass on the rest of the line.

Bottle. Brown pour, nice tan head, good retention/some lace. Aroma of belgo yeast, prune, nuts, cinnamon, caramel, toffee. Taste is moderately sweet, nuts, plum, clove, spice. Palate is dry, soft, slick, sweet finish. Good.

Bottle, probably at least a couple years old and was sort of forgotten in the cellar.  Oops.  Pours a rather clear ruby tinged copper amber color with a medium to large beige head.  Old fruit and gingerbread on the nose, plums and toast.  Yeast and old caramel.  Medium bodied, big and sweet, picking up a bit of an old paper and fruit leather note over the sweet malt.  Age is certainly apparent here.  Seems like this might have been great with one year on it, but at two to three its probably past its prime.  Still rather tasty though, moving into long spicy yeast with a gentle warming alcohol on the finish.

Brown with a red-ish hue, this classic Quebec brew smells of anise and plums. Nice head that stays and leaves some lacing. Flavor is a lot more spices, candi sugar and even a bit of marzipan. Not quite bitter, it has a somewhat aggressive carbonation that must be cleaning the palate as it never seems cloying. Overall a great brew, one that brings many fond memories of old time past.

Bouteille 500ml. Couleur brun foncé presque opaque, mousse moka riche et dense laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de caramel, de mélasse, de malt rôtis, dalcool et de houblon. Goût de mélasse, de malt rôtis, de houblon, avec une amertume légère. Carbonation moyenne, corps de moyenne densité.
Pours a very dark copper color. Aroma is dark fruit and yeast. Taste is same ok beer there triple is amazing.

Pours clear brownish red. Smells faintly of cherries and tastes like a thin cola/dr. Pepper that has gone flat

Goût persistent de fruits secs, dépices, de caramel, avec un lcool et une amertume parfaitement équilibrés. Un délice. Que demander de plus sinon quune étiquette un peu moins hideuse?

Bottle (500 ml). Dark brown with a medium mostly lasting off white head and beautiful lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, spices and anise. Taste is moderate sweet. Flavor of dark fruits, spices, caramel/malt, anise (strong notes, almost too much) and raisin. Slight bitterness. Medium body. Good spicy dubbel. One of the numerous good beers in Charlevoixs lineup.

Bottle from Kensington Wine Market. Partial gusher! It pours dark brown, with a gigantic beige head. The nose is fruit cake, plum, prune, raisin, spice and liquorice. The taste is caramel, prune, raisin, plum, currant, roasted malt, coffee, spice, fruit cake, liquorice, root beer, light tanginess and some underlying alcohol warmth,with a bitter-sweet finish. Medium body and lively, prickly carbonation. Solid all-round, but unfortunately somewhat over-carbonated.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2012 500ml bottle - shared by Le Posse Quebecois in Lithuania - thanks!
Where did my rating go? Trying to recreate it just from the photo I took and the memories of that day. Aggressively spicy, christmassy levels. Good dark burnt roast, bitter with such roast, but tons of sugar too. Alas I drank this out of a white tea cup, and with no head it looked a bit dull. Wow - I just found my old review, and basically Id remembered everything!

500mL Bottle, purchased in Montreal, QC. Soft soapy minerals and just a hint of peas and tomatoes. Uh oh. Is the DMS monster around or is this just heavily spiced? Flavors are decent, but the spicing is a little heavy for me, edging perfumed and soap-like. Whats wrong with the subtley of Belgian yeast and good malts? The texture of this beer is very nice, but my tongue is numb from the melange of flavoring that this has been dosed with. I want to get excited about the nices edges of this beer, but theres a strong green and herbal element throughout the pushes me away.
Très bon goût. Puissante et goût raffiné, douce en bouche, juste assez damertume.Très belle finale en bouche

The aroma is very much like raisins and plums with a bit of a sour fruit quality. There is also brown sugar, spice, and chocolate. The appearance is dark amber medium brown with a huge head. The taste is not exactly like the aroma being more bitter and quite spicy. The palate is average. Overall a nice concoction.

Deep ruby red color with lasting tan head. Nice minty holiday spice, nutmeg, toffee aromas. Light to medium body. Lightly sweet, spicy herbal, mint flavors with rootbeer, toffee, warming mildly boozy finish--tasty
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Sample on tap at Saint-Pub (Baie Saint-Paul). Pours medium brown with redish reflects. Medium frothy beige head. Aroma: malt and "fruits confits". Taste: roasted malt and fruits. Good sweetness, well balanced. Some warming alcohol. Great beer. A little heavy in summer.

500ml bottle thanks to pushkinwow, thanks 
Appearance: Dark clear mahogany with a medium sized tan head and some lacing 
Aroma: Dark fruit, raisins, yeast and toasted malts 
Taste: Toasted malts, dark fruit, sugar and some hot alcohols with a dry wine like finish 
A nice easy drinking Dubbel.

500mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours black, deep brown at the edges, with some foamy tan head. Smell is quite sweet, with some definite fruitiness that mixes with something darker and spicier, very intriguing. Palate is fairly heavy and has some light carbonation. Taste is just excellent, some definite initial sweetness that gets balanced with some bitterness initially, then slowly fades away to just let that brown sugar sweetness just linger on your tongue. I wish I had a case of this, its that good.

Good beer. Poured at a good temperature with a smallish, foamy, tan head that soon settles to a self-replenishing island and ring and no lace. Color is a hazy/cloudy amber copper with some tiny bubble trails. Aroma is malt, fruit, spice. Flavor is like nose plus sweet up front, followed by carbonic tang, little bitterness. Body is full and round and has the right carbonation to cut the sweetness. Finish is like flavor, average length, and boozy.

Verse un liquide brun opaque avec un riche col beige. Au nez, des effluves de malt, réglisse, fruits secs. En bouche, sucre de fruits mûrs, réglisse, rôtie et lègere finale dalcool. Un très beau produit, bien équilibré et complexe.

Bottle 500  ml 
Aroma:   brown sugar, plum, mineral elements, gentle hop, hint of orange and wild spice. 7+
Appearance:   slight haze on red ruby copper ale. Large fine dark tanned cap. Fine lace.
Body , Flavour , Palate and Final Notes:  full bodied with mid walls. Mineral light base with soft plum, spice , caramel and soft alcohol. Very nicely combined. Semi dry top on soft sweet bottom. Carbonation just right. Solid brew.

500ml bottle.  Pours a beautiful deep garnet, with a hefty beige head.  Aroma is molasses, dried fruit, mineral, with some earthiness, and a faint hint of raspberry.  Taste is dried red fruits, molasses, red wine, caramel, coffee, a little yeast, with some evident booziness.  Beautiful stuff.  So damn good.
(bottle) clear dark amber brown, medium tall brown head; aromas of stewed fruit, caramel; balanced flavour, very good

500ml bottle. Dark mahogany body with a huge mocha head. Great retention and tons of lacing. Aroma is quite interesting: floral hops, good dose of coriander, yeast, a hint of dark chocolate, liquorish. Taste is round and light, a touch of hops, roasted malt, raisin sweetness, a mix of dried apples & apricots, backstage yeast. Very little bitterness, and a little too much sweetness at the end. It wasnt what I expected, but for sure its a great dubbel. Wonderful experience.

From my dear Canadian brother: Pours a brown colour with a beige head. Earthy and fruity aroma, with a load of malts. Taste is an excellent mix of sweetness, tasty hops, candy, fruitiness, and a bunch more flavours. Kind of roasted. Kidn of like cake. Really well balanced and quite complex. No smudge of alcohol nowhere.

500 ml bottle thanks to Michael. Pours a murky dark reddish color with a very large off-white head. The bottle is just over 2 years old. A rich fruity nose with some toast, cherries, yeast. A very rich Belgian-inspired ale; sweet chocolates, tart cherries, delicate soft palate, raisins, a bit of light warmth. Very mellow overall. Very high up there with other amazing Dubbels such as Rochefort. A bit over-carbonated but that is likely my fault for not chilling it long enough.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2013 Bottle 500ml.
Pours dark brown with good frothy beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of malt, alchool, caramel, spices. Taste is malt, fruits, some caramel, spices. Very well balanced.[Notes: Just drank a bottle from June 2010 (2 1/2 yo) and its pretty good. I would not say better than fresh, but surely different. Nice fruits and sweetness. A bit heavy on alcohol. Worth cellaring for science, but fresh is good too. (9%).]

500ml brown bottle. 8% abv as per label. Bottled on 2011/08/23. Red-brown pour, quite clear. Modest beige ring of head which at times completely vanishes. No signs of any lacing. Nose has caramel malts, somewhat fruity, a bit of alcohol with a very deep inhale. In the mouth the beer has up front caramel and nut malt notes, some grains, raisiny fruit middle, a little darker malt emerges in the finish with darker fruit notes (plum especially) and some chocolate and light spices. Just a bit of yeast which I only noticed after pouring the second glass from the bottle which had the dregs (would not have minded more yeastiness). Medium body. Carbonation is pretty vigorous even though this beer refuses to keep its head. Overall a nice dubbel with good emerging flavours.

Finally tried one of the charlevoix. Lots of complexity. Starts off smelling sweet, something like a fruit cake with sweet rum or grande marnier. Reminds me of the rum chocolates my parents used to eat with a little spice added in.  Colour dark reddish black. Some raisins, sweet fruits, plums. Lots of alcohol. Half litre bottle.

Working on my 8th one of these from a stash I put in when it was available. Have had opportunity to taste this as a standalone drink and with a variety of foods.
500ml crown capped bottle filled 2 months ago. Pours a cloudy rusty brown color. Has a meringue like 2 finger cap that will suspend a dime. Aroma is demure with cocoa-roasty grains over some grassy hops and some yeasty funk. Flavor is rich but rounded  big roasty malts mingle with massive fruity esters, a primal earthiness and sub notes of nuts, spice, and dried fruit.long rich finish. Nice bottle conditioned ale, but it deteriorates fast- the fresher the better
Rich molasses malt flavour with hints of spices. Heavy tasting but not in a high alcohol sense more in the sense of an intense malty flavour, the alcohol content is well masked.

It pours a gorgeous translucent crimson with bright ruby highlights; the head is light-toffee, and mousey. The nose has notes of: raisins, black-pepper, fennel, a touch of rum. The taste is medium sweetness; it contains notes of: lemon-zest (top-note), plums, fennel, anise, and pepper. The palate is a medium body, a light viscosity, soft carbonation, and a long finish. Overall, very impressive; the lemon is a unique addition.

500 ml bottle. Mahogany pour with a lasting fluffy tan head. Spicy aroma of molasses, some lemon, anise and dark berries. Bready and yeasty. Flavours of sweet dark plum and raisin, slightly peppery with a citrus finish. A little bit of sour minerality on the aftertaste. Pretty good stuff.

500ml bottle. 8%ABV. pours unclear deep brown/red. aroma of spice, coriander, malt, some hops, oranges. flavour is malty with a hint of anise and qutie a bit of malt caramel malt. spicy finish. carbonation is soft. Full of flavour. Awesome! A little tweaking with the yeast used and this could really be on par or superior to Chimay Red.
heavy molasses looking pour with some head. a bit of raisins and other dried fruit. very drinkable. pretty good.

Dominus Vobiscum Double pours out a dark brown, fully opaque in the most of the body with a thin, creamy beige head. Bands of thick creamy lacing stick around the glass. The nose has an overall sweetness and fruity aroma. Notes of nuts, plum, caramel, raisin, cherry and a mild presence of alcohol. My first taste is sublime with a bit of a wheat malt subtly presenting itself midst a nutty, caramel malted middle. A sweet, cherry and beery taste with a plum and raisin aftertaste. The finish has a nice alcohol warmth, but not too much taste of alcohol. The body is a bit too thin, but creamy and delicious regardless.

Dark cola brown with a massive tan crown floating on top. Aroma is very pleasant, filled with nuts, soapy notes,  mild coffee, plum, and light caramel malt. So much roapy lacing. Cashews mixed with cherry with touch of alcohol in the finish. Lots of cherry!!! Muted Christmas spices some wheaty flavours. Im loving this beer. Cherry is starting to morph into blueberry. Mouth feel is smooth and thick, carbonation is perfect. Great brew I was not expecting any thing this awesome.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2012 (bottle from the LCBO, not aged). Served in a large wine glass @ a little below cellar temperature.  Pours a quite dark reddish brown with a large, pillowy, fine tan head which recedes slowly leaving lots of lacing.  Aroma is complex with dark fruits, a little raisin, sugar, yeast and some licorice and spice. Taste sweet molasses malt, figs and dates, some yeasty spices and a bit of hop bitterness at the finish to prevent it from being cloying. Mouthfeel is mid-weight for a Belgian, with effervescent, fine carbonation so it doesnt feel over-carbonated, and a fairly creamy finish with little detectable alcohol. I usually find doubles boring, but this is an excellent one with nice spiciness and complexity and great balance overall!

500ml bottle pours a reddish brown color with a 2 finger off-white head that leaves a little lacing on the glass.  Aromas are dark fruits with hints of yeast and chocolate.  Taste is malty sweet with some fruits and yeast and a mild spicy hop bitterness.  Medium bodied with loads of carbonation.  This is a wonderful Belgian dubbel and worthy of a tasting again and again.

500ml bottle 
8.0% ABV (as marked on bottle) 
I tried this beer on January 14, 2012 after purchasing from the Queens Quay LCBO outlet in Toronto, Ontario.  The beer poured a slightly hazed reddish-brown colour with a rocky 1" tan coloured head.  Aroma is yeast, sugar, sweet malt, and spices.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.  Flavour is sweet and fruity with a dry spicy finish.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden.

Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is mostly sweet fruit. Tastes of caramel, dark fruits, spice, candied sugar. Finishes with a cotton candy taste. Palate is mostly creamy with a light carbonation feel.

50 CL bottle... You have to love your favorite craft beer store having a moving sale... :)  First impression is this beer is almost over carbonated.  Very bubbly off-white head, and the bubbles obvious on the palate much like champagne.  Sweet taste.  Im not good at identifying tastes, but Ill say the flavor here is not something Ive run into often.  This is very unique to me, and for that, I rate it high. Only thing Im not high on is the carbonation, which distracts a bit from the taste.
500mL bottle from Broue Ha Ha.  Pours very dark brown.  Aroma is sweet dark fruit with some spices.  Taste has fruits, chocolate, and a little bit of spice, with a dry finish.  Great dubbel!

Wonderful double.  Pours a really dark brown with plentiful head.  Aromas of chocolate, pepper, belgian yeastiness.  Taste is refreshingly dry and spicy, while still maintaining enough of the dull sweetness Im used to in doubles.  Really drinkable.  The 8% is totally hidden.

Deep brown pour with a thick tan head.  The aroma is awesome.  Soft floral yeast character over a soft sweet malt.  Toasted caramel and a lot of soft spice.  There is a lightness to this beer in the aroma but also a really lovely complexity that is hard to put my finger on.  A little bit of cooked fruit and a touch of brandy-like vineousness as well.  Cinnamon and white pepper over a date molasses and fig flavour.  Really nice complexity and a lightness that lends it real drinkability.  Its the closest of the New World dubbels Ive had that approaches the drinkable character of the Belgian originals, even though its not the same flavour.  I love this.

Refrigerated 8% bottle from pushkinwow through trade poured into trappist glass.  Pours dark brown, with crimson highlights on the bottom with one and a half finger off-white head that dies down.  Some small bubble lacing, medium body, and dark fruit aroma.  Taste is caramel malt, fruit (fig and date), some molasses, and hint of hops in the finish.  On the borderline between a dubbel and a strong belgian ale.  This is good

pours a mahogany brown with a short lived off white cap. The aroma is juicy dark fruit, big on cherries, some musty notes, basement, cedar. The flavour follows suit with the big notes of juicy dark fruit, again big on cherries, some malty molasses sweetness in there, a hint of alcohol and a sort of musty, yeasty note mixed with a bit of bitterness in the finish. Love the beer, great stuff.

500 ml bottle. Pours a brownish, dark red with a pale beige head. Taste is very sweet, reminiscent of dried fruits, and also fresh green grapes. Spicy finish with very little, yet somewhat resilient berry bitterness. Complex. Body is average, velvety. Excellent double belgian.
#1044 bottle; Nose is cereal, cake, some rotten fruit, plum, alcohol whiff, cedar, feel is medium, carb is quite heavy, taste is cola, metal, mild red apple, late mellow malt

Dominus double.  Pours dark brown cloudy nice layer of light brown head.  Aroma of anise, prune, lavender, thyme, vegetables.  Medium to full bodied, abv hidden. Very nice unique blend of original elements and traditional dubbel style.

50 cl, bottled April 13, 2011. Bottle also labeled 8% abv, not the 9 that is indicated here. Nearly opaque mahogany with a small, sticky head that lasts. Nose of date, raisin, plum, dark cherry, light toffee. Flavor is the same mix, but more pronounced. Also some sweet cereal grain tastes and a touch of red wine. Medium-heavy body is to the sweet side, slick and almost sticky at times, but never cloying.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with ruby highlights and a large, fizzy light tan head, short retention with  light lacing.  Aroma is caramel, cookie, and bread malt with fragrant spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger) and dark fruits (dates, figs, plums) and cellar notes.  Flavor is heavy malt, lightly sweet with dark fruits and spices, no perceivable hops with a dry finish.  Full body, high warmth, medium-high carbonation.
Bière de type abbey Dubbel de 9% dalcool, de couleur rouge, dégusté à la microbrasserie de charlevoix.

Bottle from Gatineau beer store. Pours deep brown with lasting tan head.  Nose of vanilla,  raisin, spice and light caramel.  Taste is overly sweet with candied sugar, notes of dark fruits, spice. Body a bit light for the style. Tart cherry in the finish. Nice Quebec dubbel!
Great for cooking beef shoulder and to serve with the same dish. Sweetish taste with caramel, almond, marsipan, hazelnut

Bottle served in a tulip. Pours dark brown-amber with a large sparse beige head. Average retention and minimal lace. Booming nose of spice, pepper, stewed tomatoes, and tabasco. Were talking a killer spaghetti sauce or an impressive bloody mary. Either way, there isnt much like it. Very sweet dark fruit, brown sugar, and syrupy flavor. Medium body, creamy texture, and fizzy carbonation which gives way to a long sticky finish that warms all the way.

Bière brune rougeâtre. Des odeurs de figues et de dattes séchées prennent tout de suite la place, suivi darômes plus subtils dherbes et de poivre. En bouche, cest un goût dagrume que je perçois dabord, avec des pointes de coriandre ainsi quune faible présence anisée, contenant une amertume qui picote la langue et on détecte une fin sucrée. Un beau mélange entre le Kik Cola et le Jagermeister. (Un détail: sur la bouteille cest inscrit 8% et non pas 9 % comme lindique la fiche Ratebeer)

500 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a dark mahogany colour with good-sized tan head.  Aroma is caramel, some raisins/plums and a little spice.  Flavour is caramel, dark fruit, a little vanilla and a light spiciness.  Alcohol is very well-hidden.  Very quaffable yet flavourful.

Brown coloured beer with almost no carbonation and a large off-white head. Strong herby and fruity hinted aroma (hints of dades, raisins and peppers) with a light caramel roasted touch. Full light creamy palate; Finish is strong sweet herby with some malty alcoholic hints. Very good.

50cl bottle.  Large beige head that tops a cloudy reddish-brown body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, candi sugar, caramel, some banana, light spicy.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, candi sugar, banana, some raisin, spicy.  Effervescent medium-full body, light stickiness, quite drinkable.

bottle; dark red to brown with small beige head; aroma-black licorice, dried fruits, raisins, cherries caramel, alcohol; taste-light sweetness, heavy long-lasting bitter, moderate carbonation, warming feel of the alcohol. Nice aroma that doesnt come through during the taste, mostly lost to alcohol, the bitterness and tart cherries.

Flavor is dominated by malts and spices, hard to detect the spices due to nothing else is similar to it.  The flavor is much the same as the aroma.  This sort of reminds me of Hitachino XH in that it is very unique take on a Belgian Ale and very, very different than anything Ive ever had, but still very good, although not something to have except if a really offbeat ale is what I am looking for.

500ml bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours dark brown with a thick, lingering, lacy, cream-colored head.  Aroma of slightly roasted and caramel malts with a lot of dark fruits and spiciness backed with a little hops.  Flavor strong of the dark fruits.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer.

16.9oz bottle.  Deep unfiltered burgundy-brown.  Creamy, steady beige head.  Phenomenal sweet aroma,spicy, with vanilla cinnamon fullness.  Wow.  Certainly a unique creature, not your standard double.  One of the better beers Ive had in recent memory, truly excellent.  Herbal, sweet tea tones, sugary.  Effervescent fluffy body.  Enough classic brown sugar and raisin notes to stay on the edge of the style.  Seek this beer out.  Wow.
Bottle from volo. Dark brown with small head. Light thin carbonation with yeasty undertones. Really great beer. Would have again.

Deep reddish brown beer with a golden tan head.  Good retention but no lacing. Aroma is sweet and yeasty with a slight tart cherry smell.  Very full bodied with lots of alcohol.  Flavor is sweet, malty, fruity with a touch of carmel.  Overall a really nice beer that pairs well with the dark chocolate desert my wife took out of the oven towards the end of my sampling.

500ml bottle. Dark mahogany with a coppery off-white head. Yeast, banana, lightly burnt caramel, malt, brown sugar and spice. Good carbonation, slightly sweet, booze is well hidden, nice yeast and spice throughout. Nice and smooth, easy to drink, nice dubbel.

Bottle shared by emacgee.  Cheers, Ethan!  Again, I think I differ from my compatriots on this one, which I thought was unique and interesting.  Gushed out of the bottle, but then poured copper/amber with a prominent head.  Nose showed spice (curacao? coriander? hell if I know), raisins, figs, and dark fruit. Doesnt taste like any other dubbel Ive had.  Tastes surprisingly fruity, and I got a decent amount of kefir lime and lemongrass, which was not at all expected.

Super carbonated, clean deep ruby copper pour with one finger of fizzy tan head. Interesting nose,very spicy with lots of rich dark fruity and notes of peppercorn and burnt sugar. Spicy/rummy/fruity flavor, reminiscent of a spiced holiday cake. Slight acidity. Spritzy mouthfeel.

Bottle, shared by emacgee.  Gusher!  Dark amber with thick white head.  Very spicey, xmas cake, cinnamon, some dark fruits.  A little metallic and bloody in the flavor.  Creamy, with some nuts, spices, dark fruits.   Spicy--slightly lip-numbing palate.  Interesting, but a little hard to drink much of this.

Bière couleur de noisette aux reflets pourpres, coiffée dun ample col taupe.  De riches arômes bien boisés de céréales, de fruits rouges, de grappa...  Très légèrement amère avec une pointe dacidité et un goût métalique.  Effervescence moyenne, légèrement astringente avec une fin largement arômatique.

Dark brown body with a beige foamy head.  Dark fruity aroma with sweet hints of  anise.  Nice cinnamon / toffee taste. You can also feel delicate spicy  waves on your tongue. Not too agressive even if the alcool % is pretty high. A very nice beer .

Bottle. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a sweetish malty spicy aroma with some yeasty hints. Fruity sweetish malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a sweetish fruity malty spicy finish.

Feb. 04, 2010 bottling.  The beer pours to a deep mahogany body with a tall lively super light tan head.  This beer wanted out of the bottle, so I am uncertain of infection.  Tastes fine.  The aroma is dusty raisins and aromatic bitters.  The flavor is sweet raisins, nice malt backbone, fennel bulbs, and is sweet without the cloying of a dubbel.  The alcohol is really well hidden.  9% seems like 6.5.  Theres a sweet palate that is fortunately not sticky.  Lingers only for 30 seconds or so.  Medium full body.  I dont think it is infected, merely over-carbonated.  It wanted out!

Bottle as pictured, Pours very heady, aroma was of yeasty and spices. Beer tastes very yeasty with a lot of spices and a nice bitterness that goes along with other doubles. A nice dryness in the back and very tasty stuff. Good beer would have more

En bouteille. Belle mousse en versant dans le verre qui disparaît malheureusement trop rapidement. Apparence limpide de couleur rubis. Belle remontée de bulles. Arômes de prunes séchées, de caramel et dépices. En bouche, elle est plutôt mince avec une belle balance entre le sucré, lalcool et lamertume. Bonne bière.

Bottle. Pours a hazy brown color with a large frothy light brown head that lasted and produced good lacing. Moderate to heavy complex spice & herbs and yeast aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet spice and yeast flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Interesting good brew.

Hazy brownish color with a medium sized, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of dark fruits, belgian yeast, caramel malts, spices, and light alcohol.  Taste of the same dark fruits, spices, vanilla, caramel malts, light nuts, and a bit of alcohol in the finish.

500ml bottle. Pour with decent carbonation. it is quite clear but almost red tea in colour. Highly expressive notes of rose petal of something herbal right off the bat; maybe from the high alcohol? Then i get caramel, brown sugar and and prunes or dried fruit. Palate is smooth, very complex and very good length. a good brew. although i do find the mid-palate a bit thin.

Bouteille 500 mL (4) - Belle couleur brune avec une fine couche de mousse blanche. Arômes de fruits confits épicés. Même goût mais avec une petite touche sucrée. Je laurais prise avec un petit peu plus de corps mais elle reste quand même une très très bonne bière!

Bottle: &nbsp Deep brown, nearly black, moderate to large foamy head, light beige, rather nice lacing. &nbsp Dark fruity aroma, sweet breadiness, molasses and toffee. &nbsp Smells pretty friggen sweet! &nbsp Er I mean awesome! &nbsp Also seems fairly spicy, more than most Abbey Dubbels, which is fine by me! &nbsp Dark pitted fruit and oddly enough, pumpkin like spices (minimal) on the tongue. &nbsp That includes nutmeg, cinnamon, all-spice perhaps. &nbsp Has a fig/date aspect, perhaps a touch of anise. &nbsp So much going on with this one. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel, not too heavy. &nbsp This one was a little unexpected, had no idea I would enjoy this one as much as I am. &nbsp The nose on this is just so nice. &nbsp Somewhat reminds me of a Pumpkin Stout for some reason. &nbsp More anise on the finish, dark pitted fruits, molasses, just friggen good! &nbsp This is like a Dubbel (slash) Spiced Ale. &nbsp Just cant keep sniffing this one!
This is a BIG beer. Very tasty, alcohol presence with plum flavours. Great stuff.

You know, its a four for appearance - nice off-white head, a decent clear amber, Charlevoixs Dominus line has its appearances down for sure. The aroma, however, is a weak malt-sugar concoction that tells me they need to pay attention to other aspects of the beer. The flavour is sweet malt with a dry finish; a classic Belgian-style mix thats reliable, but uncomplex and unexceptional, but hard to go wrong with.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 pours murky dark-reddish brown with a creamy beige head, good retention and lacing. caramel malts, roasted cereals, dark fruits, figs, dattes, brown sugar, chocolate... just wow-complex. just the right amount of sweetness, great balance with the hops - slightly grassy. masterpiece!

Bière brune très foncée de 8 % dalcool. Col intéressant au versement, cette bière possédait un goût désaltérant lorsque tempérée. Je nai pas reconnu la touche épicée, mais larrière-goût était intéressant. Aspect caramélisé ou bien liquoreux intéressant.

500 ml bottle. Dark brown color. Stong marlty and nutty aroma, yet a finely balanced beer, even if spicier than average for a beer of this kind. I could not choose between this one and the triple, I like em both a LOT ...!

500 ml bottle poured a clear reddisah brown with a lasting beige head. Aromas of cola, toffee, carmel, plum, fig and light spice. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a smooth finish. Flavors of cola, toffee, plum, spice, light fig and light carmel with a smooth lingering fruity cola finish.

dark Brown heavy carb beige head. thx to other comments tasted that one warm. A: Spicy, brown sugar, caramel, dark fruits. F: Thin to med body finish is short but sweet. superb highly drinkable like the fact that its more malty than spicy.

Bottle from Westlake view liquors. Nice and dark with lofty crisp champagne head and a little cloudiness. Fresh green apple aroma with musky mature yeasts. Very smooth, mellow malts with a slight apple and prune zing. Lots of carbonation, foam just kept comming, needed to let this one sit for a good 15 minutes.  Started off too bubbly, also let this warm up and mellow out a bit. The flavors just jumped out after that. Lots of muskyness, sweet belgian sugars, roasted malts, a uniqueness to this brew. Nice complexity to this beer. Interesting and enjoyable.

Bottle: pours dark reddish brown with a thin white head, very sweet aroma with hints of cherries and other dark fruit, taste of dark fruit and some caramel, thin bodied, plenty of of carbonation.  Solid.

brown pour with a huge foamy light tan head.
aroma is dark fruit, corriander and clove , hint of ginger spiciness. some light woody hop.
flavour is dark fruit again, vanilla and some molasses and cola sweetness balanced by the spice. pretty sweet, but not cloyingly so.
Pleasant and drinkable.
